block.p: Assembly Speaker Jack Collins announced yesterday that he was forming a bipartisan commission to review state education policies, particularly school financing. He noted that New Jersey had the highest spending rate per student in the country, with most financing coming from property taxes, which are also among the highest in the nation.

Assembly Speaker Jack Collins announced yesterday that he was forming a bipartisan commission to review state education policies, particularly school financing. He noted that New Jersey had the highest spending rate per student in the country, with most financing coming from property taxes, which are also among the highest in the nation.
Mr. Collins said the commission would examine ideas about long-term education financing and the measuring of educational progress.
